title: Am I the only one having a reaction time crisis against Kat?
body:
I can't seem to lane with her, I never can. Everything she does is too instant for me to react to.

I'm just looking for any tips when versing a Katarina.

replies.body:
when you cant react fast enough, you must instead rely on prediction.




















but yeh nah she is bs. when im on champs who should beat her, i played to scared from the start and mess up

Just time her abilities and punish her when e is down, might want to play a few games as Kat so you can learn her q and e range, when she jumps to you it's will always be behind you so don't always run towards your tower, her q does the same damage to all targets so try and stay away from friendly minions as much as possible, make her chose between farming or poking with her q , once you respect and learn the matchup you can see that her movements are quite predictable

Play urgot , i smash kat with urgot.

Pretty much smash her with e+q+W's slow+tlords combo and if she ults you just ult her right back and it cancels her ult. even if you land 1 out of 4 e's+3 q's its pretty much half her health with a couple of longswords.

Really any champ with good range and some form of cc should smash kat assuming she doesn't roam the whole game and snowball from the other lanes.

It takes practice, both in terms of mechanics and awareness. Kat is unlikely to take you from 100-0 in laning phase but will look to make favourable trades until you're low enough to finish off. If you try your best to stay healthy and/or be the one making the favourable trades you will usually have enough time to react to her all in, unless it's a well timed gank that catches you off guard. Of course, it depends on the matchup as well. A Lissandra who can just ult Kat or herself is going to survive more often than a Lux potentially would. Finally, pushing her wave into tower and warding the river will hopefully stop her from roaming and give you the knowledge if she does so that your team can attempt to deny Kat from snowballing.

The absolute fastest reaction time recorded is 0.101 seconds. But for those of us who aren't Batman; the average reaction time is 0.2 seconds...

Now, Katarina kills you in around 0.1 - 0.15 seconds (no exaggeration, my death recap has stated this multiple times) that means it is literally impossible for you to react in any way to her burst... 

So don't worry, its not only you. Even if you somehow could react in that 0.04 seconds, the cast and travel time of your CC wouldn't hit her until after you are dead. 

So basically the only thing you can do, is predict when and where she will jump and aim your CC there, (but heres the catch) her Shunpo blinks to a random location around you (so if your CC is a skillshot... good luck) also her Shunpo is instant so predicting the exact moment she is going to jump and throwing your CC at the exact right time to hit her after she exits Shunpo, is nigh on impossible. and if you should miss your CC, then you have absolutely no defence left, and you WILL die. 

Good thing they are re-working her then ^^

Well not entirely accurate. The death recap will indeed state the damage took and time taken to deliver said damage.
But that's damage taken after getting close and activating her ability(s). It does sound absurd to be able to react to her Shunpo, but I have seen people with some amazing flash/zhonyas reaction times against kat.

I have fluked a reaction on zhonyas to her Shunpo, where I was waiting for her to basically dissapear and my zhonyas activated in the time she dissapears to the time she reappeared (seen this on replay slowed). The down side, she Shunpo'd to the guy next to me so it was kind of a waste lol. Saved me from her ultimate but.

So it's possible, albeit difficult
You have to admit though, having a champion that is "possible to escape from, if you fluke it" isn't exactly healthy for the game.

Haha true. Perhaps it wasn't a "fluke" as such since I was expecting it and it was premeditated.. More of those "bet you couldn't do that again if you tried" moments.

I guess just build MR and try absorb the best she's got, then unleash whatever you got. Be it a full combo, or a GTFO of here escape package

a note I'm pretty sure that kat's shunpo puts her right behind you or at least that's always been the case for me. Good counters to kat is just build some mr, zhonias or just land cc when she ults. The number of times I screwed up a katarina ulting me and my team as heimerdinger or zilean is pretty high. Sure it does alot of damage but unless you forgot to ward or you're really clumped up and low hp you can generally stop her; also at low elo you'll a number of katarina's who don't understand the point of chain casting your ult and so there will be that extra 0.1s delay.
you need to predict her shunpo location and when it happens set up the cc right behind her target and you'll put her at your mercy, cc'd and without her ult or shunpo.

Build mr, don't let her wear you down from afar with her Q, don't pick a champ she can out-stat/out-maneuver :l???? http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment/y3y9Hcgn-aram-team-serious-aram-players-only?comment=0009 (???exampleszzz???) Oh yeah turn on smart-cast if you want fast casting too, but personally I don't like using it because of aiming in tight fights (everybody's like in a mosh pit
), people misleading skill shots into missing or enemies running almost into range then backing out to lead you towards them. Preferably if you know ability ranges by heart. I even use dorans on ranged champions sometimes (e.g Teemo vs Ryze top).

I think Kat is a bit like Leblanc. It can be hard to react in time, but you can try to think from the Kat's perspective to _predict_ what they will do next. For LB it's always pretty obvious when she's going to dash in, so you can prepare your cc accordingly. Similarly with Kat, she's always going to be looking for a chance to jump in and get some damage off. Play proactively instead of reactively against her :)
